oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Conducting polymers: novel materials for chemical and bio-sensors
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: LAL, R
SUKEERTHI, S
DABKE, RB
CONTRACTOR, AQ
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: electrochemical sensors
coated electrodes
polypyrrole films
gas sensors
oxidation
fabrication
biosensors
devices
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Conducting polymers are novel organic semiconducting materials with promise in a wide range of electronic applications from charge storage to sensors. The electronic and optical properties of these polymers are very sensitive to their chemical and electrochemical state, with conductivities changing by several orders of magnitude in response to small changes in the chemical/electrochemical state. This property has been exploited to develop sensors, and electronic switching devices. Some of the progress in this direction is described here with specific reference to work done at IIT, Bombay.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: INDIAN JOURNAL OF PURE & APPLIED PHYSICS,34(9)589-594
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 38th Annual DAE Solid State Physics Symposium,CALCUTTA, INDIA,DEC 27-31, 1995
